Package oop.ex6.Scopes

Class ScopeFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • oop.ex6.Scopes.ScopeFactory

  • public class ScopeFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A class implementing the factory design pattern, creates Scope instances.

      • createScope

        public static Scope createScope​(LineAnalyzer.LineType format,
                                LineAnalyzer lineAnalyzer,
                                java.lang.String line,
                                Scope curScope,
                                GlobalScope globalScope,
                                boolean checkGlobal)
                         throws IllegalDeclarationException,
                                TypeNotSupportedException,
                                InvalidBooleanExpressionException,
                                MissingMethodNameException,
                                InvalidArgumentsException,
                                IncompatibleTypeException
        Create a new Scope instance, considering the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        format - One of enumerated kinds of legal code lines.
        lineAnalyzer - A LineAnalyzer instance.
        line - The current line of sourceFile the program is processing.
        curScope - The current scope.
        globalScope - The global scope.
        checkGlobal - A boolean value, Indicating if we're in our first run over the file.
        Returns:
        The new scope to become curScope.
        Throws:
        IllegalDeclarationException - Thrown in case of an illegal declaration.
        MissingMethodNameException - Thrown in case of a missing method name.
        InvalidArgumentsException - Thrown in case of an invalid argument.
        IncompatibleTypeException - Thrown Thrown if a value's type is'nt compatible a variable's.
        TypeNotSupportedException - Thrown in case of an operation unsuported by s-Java.
        InvalidBooleanExpressionException - Thrown Thrown if a boolean expression is found to be invalid
